meaning: A region between the Tigris and Euphrates rivers that developed the first urban societies. In the Bronze Age this area included Sumer and the Akkadian¸ Babylonian and Assyrian empires¸ In the Iron Age¸ it was ruled by the Neo-Assyrian and Neo-Babylonian empires.
A mixture of rich soil and tiny rocks
A geographical area of fertile land in the Middle East stretching in a broad semicircle from the Nile to the Tigris and Euphrates
the fertile land surrounding a river
intersection
A group of gods; a group of people so accomplished in a skill or field that they seem like gods
The study of the moon¸ stars¸ and other objects in space
A description of how close a measurement is to the true value of the quantity measured.
farm animals; domestic animals raised for their working ability or for their value as a source of food and other products
Is a numeral system the people of Sumer used that has a numeral base of 60
a person who makes and repairs wooden objects and structures.
a mixture of copper and tin
a craftsman who works with stone or brick
small¸ solid pieces of material that come from rocks or living things
a written collection of laws¸ often organized by subject
A system formed by the interaction of a community of organisms with their physical environment
Place where an organism lives
A group of ecosystems that share similar climates and typical organisms
network of complex interactions formed by the feeding relationships among the various organisms in an ecosystem
A series of steps in which organisms transfer energy by eating and being eaten
An organism that obtains energy by feeding on other organisms
organism that breaks down and obtains energy from dead organic matter
diagram that compares energy used by producers¸ primary consumers¸ and other trophic levels
All the living organisms that inhabit an environment
Nonliving components of environment.
